title: The Blue 9
text:
The Blue 9 ("Plavi 9") is a <a href="1950%20in%20film">1950</a> <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>n <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="comedy">comedy</a> <a href="film">film</a>. The film was directed by <a href="Kre%C5%A1o%20Golik">Krešo Golik</a>.
That film is a bizarre mixture of the Soviet-style industrial epic, romantic comedy and football film. It is famous for superbly directed football sequences. After release it quickly became the biggest hit of then-young Yugoslav cinema.
This film is first Croatian movie with <a href="sport">sport</a> as the main topic. "The Blue 9" is also first Croatian <a href="comedy%20film">comedy film</a> from sound era.
Movie was filmed on the locations in <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a> (<a href="Split%20%28city%29">Split</a>, <a href="Rijeka">Rijeka</a> and <a href="Zagreb">Zagreb</a>) and in <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a> (<a href="Belgrade">Belgrade</a>).
External links.
